{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3555631,"name":null,"username":"swifteh30","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/d2c977/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-12T23:06:47.826Z","cooked":"

My team is trying swerve drive for the first time and its mainly me working on wiring, so I just needed a bit of help lol.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-03-12T23:06:47.826Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":19,"reads":106,"readers_count":105,"score":131.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":495364,"topic_slug":"how-to-wire-sds-mk4i-swerve-modules-ctr-cancoder-and-neo-motors","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74278,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-wire-sds-mk4i-swerve-modules-ctr-cancoder-and-neo-motors/495364/1","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3555758,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-13T02:24:54.759Z","cooked":"

Both motors and the CANcoder need 12V power, and everything is on CAN. You can look up advice on hooking up CANcoder power here on CD. Motor power has to go to the PDP/PDH. And CAN wiring is the same for all of these devices.

Where are you located? What is your team number?

You will get to a suitable solution much faster if you can meet up, in-person, with an experienced team to look at what you have and show you what you need to do. There are a lot of details to get right. They may see problems that you don’t know are problems.

Team #8090
Located in roxboro nc

If anyone could help with programming that’d be great!

If you haven’t started coding yet, I’d start with YAGSL.

We have the same hardware choices as you, so you could peek at our code for some of the YAGSL config specifics. I make no claim that ours is perfect, but it’s clearly working. You will also have to do some methodical reading and direction following, but the result should be a basic functioning bot.
